en: People want more money to expand educational institutions.
zh: 人们希望有更多的资金来扩建教育机构。

en: And I call on the chairman of the Education Committee to support the motion.
zh: 我呼吁教育委员会主席支持这项动议。

en: The local school board would go to any length to ban that book.
zh: 当地学校董事会将不惜一切代价来禁止那本书。

en: The Board of Education governs the schools.
zh: 教育委员会管理学校。

en: Education is one of the most essential aspects of life.
zh: 教育是生活中最重要的方面之一。

en: Education is an investment in the future.
zh: 教育是对未来的投资。

en: Education does not consist simply in learning a lot of facts.
zh: 教育不仅仅在于学习大量的知识。

en: Education aims to develop potential abilities.
zh: 教育旨在发展潜在的能力。

en: Education helps to mold character.
zh: 教育有助于塑造性格。

en: Education is the agent of progress.
zh: 教育是进步的推动力。

en: Education is a critical element.
zh: 教育是一个关键要素。

en: Education must not be limited to our youth, but it must be a continuing process through our entire lives.
zh: 教育不应仅限于我们的青年，而应是我们整个生命中持续不断的过程。

en: Education starts at home.
zh: 教育始于家庭。

en: Education shouldn't be aimed at passing a test.
zh: 教育的目的不应该是为了通过考试。

en: The goal of education is not wealth or status, but personal development.
zh: 教育的目标不是财富或地位，而是个人发展。

en: Education should be carried further than it is now.
zh: 教育应该比现在更进一步。

en: It is impossible to exaggerate the importance of education.
zh: 教育的重要性无论怎么强调都不为过。

en: What is the ultimate purpose of education?
zh: 教育的最终目的是什么？

en: Educational reforms still have a long way to go.
zh: 教育改革还有很长的路要走。

en: The value of education cannot be overemphasized.
zh: 教育的价值无论怎么强调都不为过。

en: My education has made me what I am.
zh: 我的教育造就了今天的我。

en: One of the great superstitions about education is that learning is the result of teaching.
zh: 关于教育的一个最大的迷信是，学习是教学的结果。

en: More money for education will spur economic growth.
zh: 增加教育投入将刺激经济增长。

en: Examinations play a large part in education.
zh: 考试在教育中扮演着重要的角色。

en: Education doesn't consist of learning a lot of facts.
zh: 教育不仅仅在于学习大量的知识。

en: We basked in his favor.
zh: 我们沐浴在他的恩惠之中。

en: We called upon him for a speech.
zh: 我们请他做了一次演讲。

en: We demanded that he explain to us why he was late.
zh: 我们要求他向我们解释他为什么迟到。

en: We had no choice but to leave the matter to him.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能把这件事交给他。

en: We expect much of him.
zh: 我们对他期望很高。

en: We showed him some pictures of the Alps.
zh: 我们给他看了一些阿尔卑斯山的图片。

en: We are expecting him any moment.
zh: 我们随时都在等他。

en: We took his success for granted.
zh: 我们认为他的成功是理所当然的。

en: We could not but give him up for dead.
zh: 我们不得不认为他已经死了。

en: We received word of his death.
zh: 我们收到了他去世的消息。

en: We expected him to support us.
zh: 我们期望他支持我们。

en: We expect that he'll help us.
zh: 我们期望他会帮助我们。

en: We objected, but she went out anyway.
zh: 我们反对，但她还是出去了。

en: We admit that he is a man of ability.
zh: 我们承认他是一个有能力的人。

en: We went to the museum.
zh: 我们去了博物馆。

en: We walked along an avenue of tall poplars.
zh: 我们沿着一条高大的杨树林荫道走着。

en: We had a gallop over the hill.
zh: 我们在山上跑了一段路。

en: We never work on Sunday.
zh: 我们从不在星期天工作。

en: We are enthusiastic Hanshin Tigers fans.
zh: 我们是狂热的阪神虎队球迷。

en: We work on every day of the week except Sunday.
zh: 除了星期天，我们每天都工作。

en: We tend to think that our time is our own only on Sundays and holidays.
zh: 我们往往认为只有在星期天和节假日，我们的时间才是自己的。

en: We are subject to the Constitution of Japan.
zh: 我们受日本宪法的约束。

en: We must maintain the friendly relations between Japan and the U.S.
zh: 我们必须维护日本和美国之间的友好关系。

en: We should have taken the schedule into consideration.
zh: 我们应该考虑到日程安排。

en: We must sleep at least eight hours a day.
zh: 我们每天必须睡至少八个小时。

en: "Good morning", said Tom with a smile.
zh: “早上好，”汤姆笑着说。

en: Why does one say "Good day" when the day is not good?
zh: 为什么在日子不好的时候还要说“今天好”呢？

en: Wine is poetry filled in bottles.
zh: 葡萄酒是装在瓶子里的诗歌。

en: That was the best day of my life.
zh: 那是我一生中最美好的一天。

en: I don't understand German.
zh: 我不懂德语。

en: I made my decision.
zh: 我做了决定。

en: I give you my word.
zh: 我向你保证。

en: We have a Pope.
zh: 我们有教皇了。

en: There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
zh: 世界上有10种人：懂二进制的和不懂二进制的。

en: Don't worry, be happy!
zh: 别担心，开心点！

en: I find foreign languages very interesting.
zh: 我觉得外语很有趣。

en: I don't like learning irregular verbs.
zh: 我不喜欢学习不规则动词。

en: Take a book and read it.
zh: 拿本书读读。

en: You make me dream.
zh: 你让我做梦。

en: I'm beside myself with joy.
zh: 我欣喜若狂。

en: The vacation is over now.
zh: 假期结束了。

en: I'm afraid to fall.
zh: 我害怕坠落。

en: That's the absolute truth.
zh: 那是绝对的真相。

en: It's cold.
zh: 很冷。

en: I'm thirsty.
zh: 我渴了。

en: When I ask people what they regret most about high school, they nearly all say the same thing: that they wasted so much time.
zh: 当我问人们他们对高中生活最后悔的事情是什么时，他们几乎都说同一件事：他们浪费了太多时间。

en: When you can't do what you want, you do what you can.
zh: 当你想做的做不了时，就做你能做的。

en: Give him an inch and he'll take a yard.
zh: 得寸进尺。

en: You did this intentionally!
zh: 你是故意的！

en: You didn't tell him anything?
zh: 你什么都没告诉他？

en: I would rather stay at home than go out.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿出去。

en: It is better to stay in than go out.
zh: 待在家里比出去好。

en: I'd rather stay home than go out.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿出去。

en: I would rather stay home than go out.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿出去。

en: Didn't you go out?
zh: 你没出去吗？

en: People traveling abroad always have to get used to new food.
zh: 出国旅行的人总是要习惯新的食物。

en: There are lots of benefits from travelling abroad.
zh: 出国旅行有很多好处。

en: We should not put restrictions on foreign trade.
zh: 我们不应该限制对外贸易。

en: Foreign products arrived on the market in large quantities.
zh: 外国产品大量涌入市场。

en: If you engage in espionage for a foreign power, you are selling your country down the river.
zh: 如果你为外国势力从事间谍活动，你就是在出卖你的国家。

en: We should not use foreign workers as a buffer against Japan's economic slowdown.
zh: 我们不应该利用外国工人来缓冲日本的经济衰退。

en: The influx of foreign workers has caused a serious housing problem in this area.
zh: 外国工人的涌入已经导致该地区严重的住房问题。

en: I don't have a prejudice against foreign workers.
zh: 我对外国工人没有偏见。

en: We give foreign tourists the privilege of tax exemption.
zh: 我们给予外国游客免税的特权。

en: Foreign students demanded help from us.
zh: 外国学生要求我们提供帮助。

en: It is difficult for foreign students to speak English well.
zh: 外国学生很难说好英语。

en: Another tendency of many Japanese that bothers foreigners is to make statements that are too general and too broad by using or implying words like "all" and "every".
zh: 许多日本人令外国人困扰的另一个倾向是，通过使用或暗示“所有”和“每个”之类的词语，做出过于笼统和宽泛的陈述。

en: Foreigners admire Mt. Fuji.
zh: 外国人钦佩富士山。

en: Foreigners complain that it is difficult to get to know Japanese people. To some extent this may be true.
zh: 外国人抱怨说很难了解日本人。在某种程度上，这可能是真的。

en: Only if a foreigner has read much English poetry can he understand Shakespeare.
zh: 只有当外国人读过很多英国诗歌，他才能理解莎士比亚。

en: Foreigners in general don't need as many compliments as Japanese are required to give each other, and it is good to keep this in mind.
zh: 一般来说，外国人不需要像日本人那样互相给予那么多的赞美，记住这一点是好的。

en: Don't make fun of foreigners' mistakes in Japanese.
zh: 不要取笑外国人在日语中的错误。

en: He will come with his wife, as is often the case with foreigners.
zh: 他会和他的妻子一起来，外国人通常都是这样。

en: A group of foreigners arrived in Edo, i.e. Tokyo.
zh: 一群外国人抵达江户，也就是现在的东京。

en: Being spoken to by a foreigner, I did not know what to do.
zh: 被外国人搭话，我不知道该怎么办。

en: You never have time for important things!
zh: 你永远都没时间做重要的事！

en: It would take me too much time to explain to you why it's not going to work.
zh: 要跟你解释为什么行不通会花我太多时间。

en: I'm so dumb... I'm trying to explain things to you that I don't understand myself.
zh: 我太蠢了... 我在试着跟你解释我自己都不懂的事情。

en: Stop seeing me as a "normal" person!
zh: 别再把我当成一个“普通”人！

en: Are you referring to me?
zh: 你是在说我吗？

en: It can't be!
zh: 这不可能！

en: I wish I could care more about my grades but it seems that, at a certain point of my life, I decided they wouldn't be so important anymore.
zh: 我希望我能更在意我的成绩，但似乎在我人生的某个阶段，我决定它们不再那么重要了。

en: "A rolling stone gathers no moss" is a proverb.
zh: “滚石不生苔”是一句谚语。

en: Would you like something to drink?
zh: 你想喝点什么吗？

en: "Who is it?" "It's your mother."
zh: “谁呀？”“我是你妈。”

en: "When will you be back?" "It all depends on the weather."
zh: “你什么时候回来？”“这完全取决于天气。”

en: "What's the matter?" asked the little white rabbit.
zh: “怎么了？”小白兔问道。

en: "What's going on in the cave? I'm curious." "I have no idea."
zh: “洞里发生了什么？我很好奇。”“我不知道。”

en: We must learn to live together as brothers, or we will perish together as fools.
zh: 我们必须学会像兄弟一样生活在一起，否则我们将像傻瓜一样一起灭亡。

en: Uh... How's that working?
zh: 呃... 这怎么样？

en: "To tell you the truth, I am scared of heights." "You are a coward!"
zh: “跟你说实话，我恐高。”“你是个懦夫！”

en: "Trust me," he said.
zh: “相信我，”他说。

en: "This is what I was looking for!" he exclaimed.
zh: “这就是我要找的东西！”他惊呼道。

en: "This looks pretty interesting," Hiroshi says.
zh: “这看起来很有趣，” 浩说。

en: Their communication may be much more complex than we thought.
zh: 他们的交流可能比我们想象的要复杂得多。

en: "The phone is ringing." "I'll get it."
zh: “电话响了。”“我去接。”

en: "That's very nice of you," Willie answered.
zh: “你真是太好了，”威利回答道。

en: "Thank you for helping me." "Don't mention it."
zh: “谢谢你帮助我。”“不用客气。”

en: Someday I'll run like the wind.
zh: 总有一天我会像风一样奔跑。

en: "She likes music." "So do I."
zh: “她喜欢音乐。”“我也是。”

en: We may well take pride in our old temples.
zh: 我们完全可以为我们的古老寺庙感到自豪。

en: What if we should fail?
zh: 如果我们失败了怎么办？

en: As we went around the corner, the lake came into view.
zh: 当我们转过拐角时，湖泊映入眼帘。

en: We naturally got excited.
zh: 我们自然而然地感到兴奋。

en: Our train had already pulled out when we arrived at the station.
zh: 当我们到达车站时，我们的火车已经开走了。

en: The day will soon come when we will conquer space and travel to the moon.
zh: 我们征服太空并前往月球的那一天很快就会到来。

en: We are the first to arrive.
zh: 我们是第一批到达的人。

en: Let us stop to think how much we depend upon atomic energy.
zh: 让我们停下来想想我们有多依赖原子能。

en: To our great disappointment, the game was called off.
zh: 令我们非常失望的是，比赛被取消了。

en: It will be very important whether we win the battle or not.
zh: 我们是否赢得这场战斗将非常重要。

en: We found it impossible for us to cross the river.
zh: 我们发现我们不可能过河。

en: We actually didn't see the accident.
zh: 我们实际上没有看到事故。

en: There's no need for us to argue about this.
zh: 我们没有必要为这件事争论。

en: It takes us thirty minutes to walk from here to the station.
zh: 我们从这里走到车站需要三十分钟。

en: It is not important whether we win the game or not.
zh: 我们是否赢得比赛并不重要。

en: It is important whether we win the game or not.
zh: 我们是否赢得比赛很重要。

en: To our disappointment, our team lost the game.
zh: 令我们失望的是，我们的球队输了比赛。

en: We own a few hundred acres between the three of us.
zh: 我们三个人总共拥有几百英亩土地。

en: I'm the witchfinder general.
zh: 我是猎巫将军。

en: Our travel advice center caters to the independent traveler.
zh: 我们的旅行咨询中心为独立旅行者提供服务。

en: My name is Hopkins.
zh: 我叫霍普金斯。

en: The leader of our party met with the other leaders and talked about the problem.
zh: 我们党的领导人与其他领导人会面并讨论了这个问题。

en: Our party finally had a candidate we could put forward with pride.
zh: 我们党终于有了一个我们可以自豪地推举的候选人。

en: Our company is going to be left behind too if we don't create an environment in which we can get instant Internet access.
zh: 如果我们不创造一个可以即时访问互联网的环境，我们的公司也会被抛在后面。

en: Our company had the fortieth anniversary of its foundation.
zh: 我们公司迎来了成立四十周年纪念日。

en: We must be able to discriminate between objects and situations.
zh: 我们必须能够区分物体和情况。

en: We believe in Buddhism.
zh: 我们信仰佛教。

en: We sailed against the wind.
zh: 我们逆风航行。

en: We see things differently, according to whether we are rich or poor.
zh: 我们看待事物的方式不同，取决于我们是富有还是贫穷。

en: We should help the needy.
zh: 我们应该帮助穷人。

en: We want freedom from poverty.
zh: 我们想要摆脱贫困。

en: We should not despise a man because he is poor.
zh: 我们不应该因为一个人贫穷就鄙视他。

en: We should check the spread of the disease.
zh: 我们应该控制疾病的蔓延。

en: We're banking on you to provide all the money we need.
zh: 我们指望你提供我们需要的所有资金。

en: We smell with our noses.
zh: 我们用鼻子闻气味。

en: We are lovers of the beautiful.
zh: 我们是美的爱好者。

en: We looked down at the beautiful sea.
zh: 我们俯瞰着美丽的大海。

en: We went to New York by plane.
zh: 我们乘飞机去了纽约。

en: We traveled to Mexico by plane.
zh: 我们乘飞机去了墨西哥。

en: We furnished the refugees with blankets.
zh: 我们为难民提供了毯子。

en: We must keep down expenses.
zh: 我们必须控制开支。

en: We extended a hearty welcome to them.
zh: 我们对他们表示热烈的欢迎。

en: We admire her for her bravery.
zh: 我们钦佩她的勇敢。

en: We hadn't so much as heard of her name.
zh: 我们甚至没有听说过她的名字。

en: We are anxious about her health.
zh: 我们担心她的健康。

en: We got her to attend to the patient.
zh: 我们让她照顾病人。

en: We bound her to secrecy.
zh: 我们让她保守秘密。

en: We cannot distinguish her from her younger sister.
zh: 我们无法将她和她的妹妹区分开来。

en: We can depend on her helping us.
zh: 我们可以依靠她帮助我们。

en: We confirmed her death.
zh: 我们确认了她的死亡。

en: I have lived in Kamakura for twelve years.
zh: 我在镰仓住了十二年了。

en: Air the futon.
zh: 晒晒被褥。

en: The shareholder's meeting was held.
zh: 股东大会召开了。

en: Shareholders were concerned about the company's swift expansion overseas.
zh: 股东们担心公司在海外的迅速扩张。

en: Shareholders voted to liquidate the company's assets.
zh: 股东投票决定清算公司资产。

en: The stockholders are making money hand over fist.
zh: 股东们赚得盆满钵满。

en: Stock investments do not always yield profit.
zh: 股票投资并不总是能带来利润。

en: The stock market is often called a dangerous one.
zh: 股市常被称为一个危险的地方。

en: The stock market tumbled.
zh: 股市暴跌。

en: The stock market is in a prolonged slump.
zh: 股市长期低迷。

en: The stock market was surprisingly quiet today.
zh: 今天的股市出奇地平静。

en: The stock market has dropped today.
zh: 今天的股市下跌了。

en: The stock market is very active.
zh: 股市非常活跃。

en: The stock market is severely depressed.
zh: 股市严重萧条。

en: The stock market crash forced many retirees back into the job market.
zh: 股市崩盘迫使许多退休人员重返就业市场。

en: The stock has gone down over night.
zh: 股票一夜之间下跌了。

en: You have no grounds for accusing Jill of stealing the stock certificates.
zh: 你没有理由指责吉尔偷窃股票凭证。

en: The stock price index was off 200 points yesterday.
zh: 股票价格指数昨天下跌了200点。

en: The stock price index soared to an all-time high.
zh: 股票价格指数飙升至历史新高。

en: The price of the stock declined by half in a month.
zh: 股票价格在一个月内下跌了一半。

en: Stock prices plunged to a record low.
zh: 股价暴跌至历史最低点。

en: Stock prices declined for five consecutive days.
zh: 股价连续下跌了五天。

en: The price of stock declined by half in a month.
zh: 股票价格在一个月内下跌了一半。

en: There was a rapid decline in stock prices.
zh: 股价迅速下跌。

en: Stocks fell hard.
zh: 股票大幅下跌。

en: We can have dogs, cats, birds, and so on.
zh: 我们可以养狗、猫、鸟等等。

en: We made arrangements to meet at 6 p.m. on Monday.
zh: 我们安排了星期一下午六点见面。

en: We should not be influenced in our decisions by our prejudices.
zh: 我们不应该让偏见影响我们的决定。

en: We must control our passions.
zh: 我们必须控制我们的情绪。

en: We will never agree.
zh: 我们永远不会同意。

en: We will never give in to terrorist demands.
zh: 我们永远不会向恐怖分子的要求屈服。

en: We fought a hard battle.
zh: 我们打了一场艰苦的战斗。

en: We had to abandon our plan.
zh: 我们不得不放弃我们的计划。

en: Your help is vital to the success of our plan.
zh: 你的帮助对我们计划的成功至关重要。

en: We were disappointed because we could not carry out our plan.
zh: 我们很失望，因为我们无法执行我们的计划。

en: We learn by experience.
zh: 我们从经验中学习。

en: We cannot exclude feeling from our experience.
zh: 我们不能把感觉排除在我们的经验之外。

en: We hope to come to an accord with them about arms reduction.
zh: 我们希望就裁减军备与他们达成协议。

en: The President says we must beef up our military forces.
zh: 总统说我们必须加强我们的军队。

en: We lost sight of her in the crowd.
zh: 我们在人群中失去了她的踪影。

en: We have a good opinion of your invention.
zh: 我们对你的发明评价很高。

en: We had a good opinion of your son.
zh: 我们对你的儿子评价很好。

en: We are attracted by what you are.
zh: 我们被你的内在所吸引。

en: We are looking forward to hearing from you.
zh: 我们期待收到你的来信。

en: We can get along very well without you.
zh: 没有你，我们也能相处得很好。

en: We take air and water for granted.
zh: 我们认为空气和水是理所当然的。

en: We got an interesting piece of information.
zh: 我们得到了一条有趣的信息。

en: We are bored with the joke of professorial custom.

en: Above the music, I could hear her crying.
zh: 在音乐声之上，我能听到她在哭泣。

en: Were it not for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 如果没有音乐，世界将会是一个沉闷的地方。

en: If not for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 如果没有音乐，世界将会是一个沉闷的地方。

en: Still waters run deep.
zh: 静水流深。

en: No music, no life.
zh: 没有音乐，就没有生命。

en: Don't make any noise or you'll scare the birds away.
zh: 别发出任何声音，否则你会把鸟吓跑的。

en: Don't make any noise, I'm studying.
zh: 别发出任何声音，我在学习。

en: Don't make a noise.
zh: 别发出声音。

en: Can you keep the noise down?
zh: 你能小声点吗？

en: Leaves were dropping silently to the ground.
zh: 树叶静静地飘落到地上。

en: We fired guns at the enemy.
zh: 我们向敌人开枪射击。

en: We are faced with the alternative of resistance or slavery.
zh: 我们面临着抵抗或奴役的选择。

en: We should deal with this matter without delay.
zh: 我们应该毫不拖延地处理这件事。

en: We must die sooner or later.
zh: 我们迟早都要死的。

en: We eat bread and butter for lunch.
zh: 我们午餐吃面包和黄油。

en: We felt the ground sinking.
zh: 我们感觉到地面在下沉。

en: We have to respect local customs.
zh: 我们必须尊重当地习俗。

en: We must think about the community.
zh: 我们必须考虑社区。

en: We haven't known each other long.
zh: 我们认识的时间不长。

en: We had to learn to read the word.
zh: 我们必须学会阅读这个词。

en: None of us are related to the problem.
zh: 我们中没有人与这个问题有关。

en: Every one of us is more or less interested in art.
zh: 我们每个人或多或少都对艺术感兴趣。

en: We were taught that World War II broke out in 1939.
zh: 我们被告知第二次世界大战爆发于1939年。

en: We sang in loud voices.
zh: 我们大声唱歌。

en: We roared with laughter.
zh: 我们哄堂大笑。

en: We came up against massive popular resistance.
zh: 我们遇到了大规模的民众抵抗。

en: We used to compete furiously in college.
zh: 我们过去在大学里竞争激烈。

en: We arranged the books according to size.
zh: 我们按照大小排列书籍。

en: We arrived at a compromise.
zh: 我们达成了妥协。

en: We have no choice but to compromise.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能妥协。

en: We will explore every planet that goes around the sun.
zh: 我们将探索围绕太阳运行的每一颗行星。

en: We watched the sun setting behind the mountains.
zh: 我们看着太阳在山后落下。

en: We should make the most of solar energy.
zh: 我们应该充分利用太阳能。

en: We are exploring new sources, such as solar and atomic energy.
zh: 我们正在探索新的能源，例如太阳能和原子能。

en: We must get over many difficulties.
zh: 我们必须克服许多困难。

en: We got our roof blown off in the gale.
zh: 我们的屋顶被大风刮掉了。

en: A strong wind began to set in.
zh: 开始刮起强风了。

en: The wind blew in gusts.
zh: 风一阵阵地吹。

en: Tall buildings may sway in a strong wind.
zh: 高层建筑可能会在强风中摇晃。

en: There was a strong wind.
zh: 当时刮着强风。

en: The thieves knocked off another bank today in a daytime robbery.
zh: 今天白天，窃贼又抢劫了一家银行。

en: The robbers fell on him from behind the trees.
zh: 强盗从树后向他扑去。

en: The robber attacked her on a back street.
zh: 强盗在一条小巷里袭击了她。

en: The burglar locked the couple in the basement.
zh: 窃贼把这对夫妇锁在了地下室里。

en: The robber bashed her head in.
zh: 强盗猛击她的头部。

en: The thief forced her to hand over the money.
zh: 小偷强迫她交出钱。

en: The burglar broke into the post office in broad daylight.
zh: 窃贼在光天化日之下闯入了邮局。

en: The robber aimed his gun at the clerk.
zh: 强盗用枪指着店员。

en: The burglar tied my hands behind my back with a rope.
zh: 窃贼用绳子把我的手绑在背后。

en: The robber aimed his gun at the police officer.
zh: 强盗用枪指着警察。

en: The robbers made away with all the money in the safe.
zh: 强盗抢走了保险柜里的所有钱。

en: The cat burglar must have entered the mansion from the roof.
zh: 飞贼一定是爬上屋顶进入豪宅的。

en: The burglar was traced by one of the things he had left on the scene.
zh: 窃贼因为留在现场的东西而被追踪到。

en: The burglar shut the child in the closet.
zh: 窃贼把孩子关进了壁橱里。

en: The robber seized the bag from his hand.
zh: 强盗从他手中抢走了包。

en: Robbers wrecked the mail train.
zh: 强盗破坏了邮车。

en: The burglars broke into the bank at night.
zh: 窃贼在夜间闯入了银行。

en: The robbers fell on her there.
zh: 强盗在那里袭击了她。

en: The burglar burst into his house.
zh: 窃贼闯入了他的房子。

en: A burglar broke into his house.
zh: 窃贼闯入了他的房子。

en: Seen from the sky, the river looked like a huge snake.
zh: 从天空上看，这条河看起来像一条巨大的蛇。

en: The houses and cars looked tiny from the sky.
zh: 从天空上看，房子和汽车看起来很小。

en: The whole sky lit up and there was an explosion.
zh: 整个天空都亮了起来，然后发生了爆炸。

en: Seen from the sky, the island was very beautiful.
zh: 从天空上看，这个岛屿非常美丽。

en: The sky brightened.
zh: 天空变亮了。

en: The sky has gradually clouded over.
zh: 天空渐渐阴沉下来了。

en: Is there a vacant seat?
zh: 请问有空位吗？

en: The only room available is a double.
zh: 唯一可用的房间是双人间。

en: Do you have any vacancies?
zh: 你们有空房吗？

en: Stop grumbling.
zh: 别发牢骚了。

en: A fool's bolt is soon shot.
zh: 傻瓜的箭很快就射完了。（比喻：傻瓜很快就会用完他的伎俩或资源）

en: It is easy to be wise after the event.
zh: 事后诸葛亮容易当。

en: Who lives without folly is not so wise as he thinks.
zh: 谁自认为没有犯过傻，那他肯定没自己想的那么聪明。

en: A fool and his money are soon parted.
zh: 傻瓜的钱很快就会被骗走。

en: His parents' view was that he was wasting his earnings on a silly girl.
zh: 他的父母认为他把挣来的钱浪费在一个愚蠢的女孩身上。

en: You've acted foolishly and you will pay for it.
zh: 你做了蠢事，你会付出代价的。

en: I want specific information.
zh: 我想要具体的信息。

en: Are you feeling under the weather?
zh: 你觉得不舒服吗？

en: Take this medicine in case you get sick.
zh: 以防你生病，把这药吃了。

en: Is anything the matter with him?
zh: 他有什么问题吗？

en: I'm sick. Will you send for a doctor?
zh: 我生病了。你能请个医生来吗？

en: You are doing well for a cub reporter.
zh: 作为一个刚入行的新记者，你做得不错。

en: No pain, no gain.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: Cares and worries were pervasive in her mind.
zh: 忧虑和烦恼弥漫在她的脑海里。

en: No gains without pains.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: You should continue until you're satisfied.
zh: 你应该继续下去，直到你满意为止。

en: I'm not in the mood.
zh: 我没心情。

en: Now that I notice it, I have nowhere to run.
zh: 现在我注意到了，我无处可逃。

en: It was there, when I noticed it.
zh: 当我注意到它的时候，它就在那里。

en: I found myself back in my room.
zh: 我发现自己回到了我的房间。

en: Thank goodness, you've come to.
zh: 谢天谢地，你醒过来了。

en: It took him a moment to realize where he was after he came to.
zh: 他醒来后过了一会儿才意识到自己在哪里。

en: He was so sad that he almost went mad.
zh: 他太伤心了，几乎要疯了。

en: I met nobody on my way home.
zh: 我回家路上没遇到任何人。

en: Could you show me your return ticket?
zh: 可以给我看看你的返程票吗？

en: In the car on the way home, he was making plans for the next day.
zh: 在回家的车上，他正在为第二天做计划。

en: I met Naomi on my way home and we had a chat.
zh: 我回家路上遇到了娜奥米，我们聊了一会儿。

en: On my way home, I fell asleep on the train and rode past my station.
zh: 在回家的路上，我在火车上睡着了，坐过了站。

en: I met him on my way home.
zh: 我回家路上遇到了他。

en: On his way home, Tom met a man who he thought was an American.
zh: 在回家的路上，汤姆遇到了一个人，他以为是美国人。

en: I was caught in shower on my way home.
zh: 我回家路上淋了雨。

en: On arriving home, I discovered the burglary.
zh: 到家后，我发现家里被盗了。

en: You can go home if you like.
zh: 如果你愿意，你可以回家。

en: I may have to come home late, in which case I'll telephone you.
zh: 我可能要晚回家，如果是那样的话，我会给你打电话。

en: Returnees have trouble getting used to life in Japan.
zh: 归国人员很难适应在日本的生活。

en: I will inquire about the matter after I return home.
zh: 我回家后会询问这件事。

en: Why don't you look in on Mr Anderson on your way back?
zh: 你回去的路上为什么不去看看安德森先生呢？

en: Be sure to call home before you leave the office.
zh: 离开办公室前一定要给家里打电话。

en: Please turn out the lights when you leave.
zh: 请你离开的时候把灯关掉。

en: I'm very sorry I came home so late.
zh: 我很抱歉我回家这么晚。

en: When you want cooperation, share over many hands.
zh: 想要合作，就要集思广益。

en: I'm willing to do the job if you cooperate.
zh: 如果你合作，我愿意做这份工作。

en: We can lift the restrictions on imports once the joint agreement is signed.
zh: 一旦联合协议签署，我们就可以解除对进口的限制。

en: There is very little probability of an agreement being reached.
zh: 达成协议的可能性很小。

en: The society made him president.
zh: 协会选举他为会长。

en: The association is still a far cry from being well organized.
zh: 该协会离组织良好还差得很远。

en: The society was founded in 1990.
zh: 该协会成立于1990年。

en: The fingerprints left on the weapon correspond with the suspect's.
zh: 留在武器上的指纹与嫌疑人的指纹相符。

en: A fanatic threw a bomb at the king's coach.
zh: 一个狂热分子向国王的马车扔了一枚炸弹。

en: The GOP accused the Democrats of pork barrel politics.
zh: 共和党指责民主党搞政治分肥。

en: A republic is a nation whose head is not a king or queen, but a president.
zh: 共和国是指国家元首不是国王或女王，而是总统的国家。

en: We suggested Kyoritsu Bussan approach you for assistance.
zh: 我们建议共立物产找您寻求帮助。

en: What's everybody's business is nobody's business.
zh: 人人都管的事，就是没人管的事。

en: They came to terms with each other on how to start a joint venture.
zh: 他们就如何开始合资企业达成了协议。

en: Two different parties with common interests were on the warpath when he cut in to settle the dispute.
zh: 当他介入以解决争端时，两个有共同利益的不同政党正处于战争状态。

en: Communism is the system practiced in the Soviet Union.
zh: 共产主义是苏联实行的制度。

en: Communism was the political system in the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, but that stopped in 1993.
zh: 共产主义是苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟的政治制度，但这种情况在1993年停止了。

en: In communism, the means of production are owned by the state.
zh: 在共产主义中，生产资料归国家所有。

en: As communism has collapsed, capitalism is now accused of trying to "dominate the world."
zh: 随着共产主义的崩溃，资本主义现在被指责试图“统治世界”。

en: We will be willing to make a deal with you after the auction.
zh: 拍卖会结束后，我们愿意与您达成协议。

en: I obtained the painting at an auction.
zh: 我是在一次拍卖会上得到这幅画的。

en: Before the horse race begins, the jockeys grip the reins tightly to restrain the impatient horses.
zh: 在赛马开始之前，骑师紧紧抓住缰绳，以控制住焦躁不安的马匹。

en: With horse racing and such, these are called "stakes". For this meaning the plural form is often used.
zh: 像赛马这样的，这些被称为“赌注”。对于这个意思，通常使用复数形式。

en: I'm tickled pink about winning 10,000 yen at the horse races.
zh: 在赛马中赢了1万日元，我非常高兴。

en: I just lost at the races so I'm flat broke.
zh: 我赛马输了，所以身无分文了。

en: How much is the rent per month?
zh: 一个月租金多少钱？

en: How much is the monthly rate?
zh: 月租多少钱？

en: Our rent is four times as much as it was ten years ago.
zh: 我们的房租是十年前的四倍。

en: You're a month behind with your rent.
zh: 你欠了一个月的房租。

en: Regarding the matter of house-rent, I have come to terms with him.
zh: 关于房租的事，我已经和他达成协议了。

en: The dog had the liberty of the entire house.
zh: 那条狗可以在整个房子里自由活动。

en: I rear cattle.
zh: 我饲养牛。

en: The cattle starved to death.
zh: 那些牛饿死了。

en: Their cattle are all fat.
zh: 他们的牛都很肥壮。

en: The whole house was ill in bed.
zh: 全家都卧病在床。

en: All the family set off on the trip.
zh: 全家人都出发去旅行了。

en: It made my mother's day when all the family gathered and had a party.
zh: 全家人聚在一起开派对，让我妈妈非常高兴。

en: His whole family is like that. They're like peas in a pod.
zh: 他们全家都那样，简直是一个模子里刻出来的。

en: All my family is very well.
zh: 我全家人都很好。

en: His whole family is like that.
zh: 他们全家都那样。

en: Supporting his family was a great burden for him.
zh: 供养家庭对他来说是个沉重的负担。

en: He has to work hard so as to support his family.
zh: 他必须努力工作来养家糊口。

en: May I bring my family along?
zh: 我可以带我的家人一起去吗？

en: All the family got out of the car.
zh: 全家人都下了车。

en: We're practically family.
zh: 我们简直就像一家人一样。

en: My family are all well.
zh: 我的家人都很好。

en: A family is the smallest unit of society.
zh: 家庭是社会最小的单位。

en: The family is the most important unit in society.
zh: 家庭是社会最重要的单位。

en: The family is the basic unit of society.
zh: 家庭是社会的基本单位。

en: The family were all out reaping the corn.
zh: 全家人都出去收割玉米了。

en: When summer is over, the days grow shorter and shorter.
zh: 夏天结束后，白天会变得越来越短。

en: In England, in the summer, the sun rises at about 4 a.m.
zh: 在英国，夏天的时候，太阳大约在凌晨四点升起。

en: The alternative possibilities are neutrality or war.
zh: 其他的可能性是中立或战争。

en: Take every possible means.
zh: 采取一切可能的手段。

en: I want to go on a journey around the world if possible.
zh: 如果可能的话，我想去环游世界。

en: I'd send my kid out on his own for a while if I were you. A few hard knocks at this point might do him some good.
zh: 如果我是你，我会让我的孩子自己出去闯荡一段时间。在这个时候吃点苦头可能会对他有好处。

en: Some member countries have been lax in abiding by G-7 agreements.
zh: 一些成员国在遵守七国集团协议方面一直很松懈。

en: Was Ms. Kato your teacher last year?
zh: 加藤女士去年是你的老师吗？

en: Mr. Kato teaches us English.
zh: 加藤老师教我们英语。

en: Mr Kato, who lives in Paris, misses his family left at home.
zh: 住在巴黎的加藤先生想念留在家的家人。

en: Kato asked him many questions about the United States.
zh: 加藤问了他很多关于美国的问题。

en: Kato's class consists of forty boys and girls.
zh: 加藤的班级由四十个男孩和女孩组成。

en: Allow me to introduce Mr Kato to you.
zh: 请允许我向您介绍加藤先生。

en: Mr Kato was too old to work any longer.
zh: 加藤先生年纪太大了，不能再工作了。

en: Mr Kato is a teacher.
zh: 加藤先生是一位老师。

en: I live in Kakogawa.
zh: 我住在加古川。

en: It is difficult to relate to someone who has different values from you.
zh: 很难与价值观不同的人产生共鸣。

en: Some stores discount the price.
zh: 一些商店会打折。

en: We must cut down on prices; we can't compete.
zh: 我们必须降低价格；我们无法竞争。

en: I'll agree to the terms if you lower the price.
zh: 如果你降低价格，我就同意这些条款。

en: The prices are subject to change without notice.
zh: 价格如有更改，恕不另行通知。

en: Prices are subject to change without notice.
zh: 价格如有更改，恕不另行通知。

en: The price reflects the demand.
zh: 价格反映了需求。

en: The price varies with demand.
zh: 价格随需求而变化。

en: Prices depend on supply and demand.
zh: 价格取决于供求关系。

en: Passion creates suffering.
zh: 热情带来痛苦。

en: The train from Geneva will arrive at the station.
zh: 从日内瓦开来的火车即将到达车站。

en: I would like to give him a present for his birthday.
zh: 我想送他一份生日礼物。

en: I'm starving!
zh: 我饿死了！

en: Do you have friends in Antigua?
zh: 你在安提瓜有朋友吗？

en: A cubic meter corresponds to 1000 liters.
zh: 一立方米等于1000升。

en: I have so much work that I will stay for one more hour.
zh: 我有很多工作，所以我会再待一个小时。

en: I am married and have two children.
zh: 我已婚，有两个孩子。

en: He plays the piano very well.
zh: 他钢琴弹得很好。

en: I see it rarely.
zh: 我很少见到它。

en: I'd like to study in Paris.
zh: 我想在巴黎学习。

en: You don't know who I am.
zh: 你不知道我是谁。

en: Why don't you eat vegetables?
zh: 你为什么不吃蔬菜？

en: Why do people go to the movies?
zh: 人们为什么去看电影？

en: I'm undressing.
zh: 我在脱衣服。

en: The car crashed into the wall.
zh: 汽车撞到了墙上。

en: In a dictionary like this one there should be at least two sentences with "fridge".
zh: 像这样的字典里，应该至少有两句带有“冰箱”的句子。

en: The wind calmed down.
zh: 风停了。

en: Give me time to give you everything I have!
zh: 给我时间，我会把我拥有的一切都给你！

en: A democrat is a free citizen who yields to the will of the majority.
zh: 民主人士是服从多数人意志的自由公民。

en: Where there's a will, there's a way.
zh: 有志者，事竟成。

en: Who searches, finds.
zh: 有志者事竟成。

en: Rome wasn't built in a day.
zh: 冰冻三尺非一日之寒。

en: Silence gives consent.
zh: 沉默表示同意。

en: "Have you finished?" "On the contrary, I have not even begun yet."
zh: “你完成了吗？”“恰恰相反，我甚至还没有开始。”

en: The homeless sought shelter from a shower.
zh: 无家可归的人们为了躲避阵雨寻找避 shelter 所。

en: I spent the holidays decorating the house.
zh: 我花了很多时间装饰房子来度过假期。

en: There are scarcely any flowers in our garden.
zh: 我们的花园里几乎没有花。

en: Let me show you around our house.
zh: 让我带你参观一下我们的房子。

en: We are not cold in the house.
zh: 我们在屋里不冷。

en: All was silent in the house.
zh: 屋里一片寂静。

en: Every door in the house is locked.
zh: 房子里的每扇门都锁着。

en: I think the only problem I have now is being shut in at home.
zh: 我想我现在唯一的烦恼就是被关在家里。

en: There wasn't anybody in the house.
zh: 房子里空无一人。

en: When we have a family argument, my husband always sides with his mother instead of me.
zh: 当我们发生家庭争吵时，我丈夫总是站在他妈妈那边而不是我这边。

en: Let's take a rest in the garden instead of indoors.
zh: 我们去花园里休息一下，不要待在室内。

en: You can't have lost your coat in the house.
zh: 你的外套不可能丢在房子里。

en: The basements of the houses are likely to have problems.
zh: 房子的地下室很可能会有问题。

en: A horse passed my house.
zh: 一匹马经过我的房子。

en: My son can count up to a hundred now.
zh: 我儿子现在可以数到一百了。

en: There is a garden in front of the house.
zh: 房子前面有一个花园。

en: A number of cars are parked in front of my house.
zh: 我家门前停着几辆车。

en: There was a traffic accident in front of the house yesterday.
zh: 昨天房子前面发生了一起交通事故。

en: I made my whole family leave home.
zh: 我让我全家都离开了家。

en: She regretted deeply when she looked back on her life.
zh: 当她回顾自己的一生时，她深感后悔。

en: A fence runs around the house.
zh: 房子周围有一道栅栏。

en: I had to help with the housework.
zh: 我不得不帮忙做家务。

en: There is a fence about the house.
zh: 房子周围有一道栅栏。

en: The household was already awake at 6 in the morning.
zh: 早上六点，家里人已经醒了。

en: To make our house payments, we're going to have to tighten our belts.
zh: 为了支付我们的房款，我们必须勒紧裤腰带了。

en: We cannot help respecting his courage.
zh: 我们不禁敬佩他的勇气。

en: We can rely on his judgement.
zh: 我们可以信赖他的判断。

en: We applauded his honesty.
zh: 我们为他的诚实鼓掌。

en: We expect him to succeed.
zh: 我们期望他成功。

en: We accepted his offer.
zh: 我们接受了他的提议。

en: We opposed his plan to build a new road.
zh: 我们反对他修建新路的计划。

en: We got into his car and went to the sea.
zh: 我们上了他的车，然后去了海边。

en: We were surprised to see his injuries.
zh: 我们很惊讶看到他受的伤。

en: We are under his command.
zh: 我们听从他的指挥。

en: We were shocked at the news of his death.
zh: 我们对他的死讯感到震惊。

en: We regret his death.
zh: 我们为他的去世感到惋惜。

en: We compared his work with hers.
zh: 我们把他的作品和她的作品进行了比较。

en: We appreciate his talent.
zh: 我们欣赏他的才华。

en: We cannot help admiring his talent.
zh: 我们不禁赞赏他的才华。

en: We thought much of his first novel.
zh: 我们很看重他的第一部小说。

en: We were surprised at his conduct.
zh: 我们对他的行为感到惊讶。

en: We were greatly surprised at the news of his sudden death.
zh: 我们对他的突然去世的消息感到非常惊讶。

en: We are sorry for his mistake.
zh: 我们为他的错误感到抱歉。

en: We were afraid that we might hurt his feelings.
zh: 我们害怕会伤害他的感情。

en: We cannot speak too highly of his great achievements.
zh: 我们对他的伟大成就评价再高也不为过。

en: We cannot but wonder at his skill in skiing.
zh: 我们不禁对他的滑雪技巧感到惊叹。

en: We were all greatly amused by his jokes.
zh: 我们都被他的笑话逗乐了。

en: We came to the conclusion that we should help him.
zh: 我们得出的结论是，我们应该帮助他。

en: We bound him to secrecy.
zh: 我们要求他保守秘密。

en: We should have told him the truth.
zh: 我们本应该告诉他真相。

en: You have been a great mentor to me.
zh: 你一直是我的良师益友。

en: He was created a peer.
zh: 他被任命为同级。

en: I'd like to check some of my valuables.
zh: 我想寄存一些贵重物品。

en: Will you keep my valuables for me, please?
zh: 请你帮我保管这些贵重物品好吗？

en: Could you hold these valuables?
zh: 你能帮我保管这些贵重物品吗？

en: Can I deposit valuables here?
zh: 我可以在这里寄存贵重物品吗？

en: A valuable object decreases in value if it is damaged.
zh: 贵重物品如果损坏，价值就会降低。

en: Put your valuables in the safe.
zh: 把你的贵重物品放在保险箱里。

en: The valuables are in the safekeeping of the bank.
zh: 贵重物品由银行妥善保管。

en: You should keep your valuables in a safe place.
zh: 你应该把你的贵重物品放在安全的地方。

en: She kept her valuables in the bank for safety.
zh: 为了安全起见，她把贵重物品存在银行里。

en: Please check your valuables at the front desk.
zh: 请在前台寄存您的贵重物品。

en: That'll make for a memorable time.
zh: 那将会是一段难忘的时光。

en: Can you spare me a few minutes of your valuable time?
zh: 你能抽出几分钟宝贵的时间给我吗？

en: Would you please send me details of your products via e-mail as an attachment?
zh: 请通过电子邮件以附件的形式将贵公司产品的详细信息发送给我好吗？

en: I'm very impressed with your quality control.
zh: 我对贵公司的质量控制印象深刻。

en: We would like to distribute your product in Japan.
zh: 我们想在日本分销贵公司的产品。

en: If the quality of your product meets with our customer's approval, we will place regular orders.
zh: 如果贵公司的产品质量符合我们客户的认可，我们将定期下单。

en: What is the percentage of overseas markets for your products?
zh: 贵公司产品的海外市场占比是多少？

en: I'd like some information about your new computers.
zh: 我想了解一下贵公司的新电脑。

en: I learned about your portable copier at the Tokyo-Office '97 Expo.
zh: 我在东京'97办公用品博览会上了解了贵公司的便携式复印机。

en: It was a great pleasure for me to meet many associates of your company.
zh: 很高兴能见到贵公司的许多同事。

en: Please tell me the closest station to your office.
zh: 请告诉我离贵公司办公室最近的车站。

en: Your technical manager arranged a meeting for 1:00 p.m. on April 6, but how about April 7, at 10:00 a.m.?
zh: 贵公司的技术经理安排了4月6日下午1点的会议，但4月7日上午10点怎么样？

en: Please indicate what action you will take.
zh: 请说明您将采取什么行动。

en: I wore out two pairs of jogging shoes last year.
zh: 去年我穿坏了两双跑鞋。

en: We had a mild winter last year.
zh: 去年我们度过了一个暖冬。

en: We had a good deal of snow last winter.
zh: 去年冬天我们下了不少雪。

en: There was a lot of snow last winter.
zh: 去年冬天下了很多雪。

en: I took a cooking class last spring and learned to bake bread.
zh: 去年春天我上了一个烹饪课，学会了烤面包。

en: We moved to New York last fall.
zh: 去年秋天我们搬到了纽约。

en: I visited my father's hometown last summer.
zh: 去年夏天我去了我父亲的家乡。

en: She went there last summer.
zh: 去年夏天她去了那里。

en: Last summer, I worked part time on the farm.
zh: 去年夏天，我曾在农场做过兼职。

en: Last summer I traveled to Italy.
zh: 去年夏天我去了意大利旅行。

en: Last summer, I always took a walk in the morning.
zh: 去年夏天，我总是早上散步。

en: We had a good deal of rain last summer.
zh: 去年夏天我们下了很多雨。

en: I'll never forget visiting Paris last summer.
zh: 我永远不会忘记去年夏天去巴黎旅行。

en: The village which I visited last summer was a small one in Nagano Prefecture.
zh: 去年夏天我参观的那个村庄是长野县的一个小村庄。

en: It was not until last summer that my oldest son learned to swim.
zh: 直到去年夏天，我的大儿子才学会游泳。

en: As compared with last summer, we haven't had so much rain this year.
zh: 与去年夏天相比，今年我们没有下那么多雨。

en: Last year's pop hit was set off by a serial TV drama.
zh: 去年的流行歌曲是由一部连续剧引发的。

en: Compared with last year, this year's crops are much better.
zh: 与去年相比，今年的收成好多了。

en: I grew tomatoes last year and they were very good.
zh: 去年我种了西红柿，非常好吃。

en: He began to work for that company last year.
zh: 他去年开始在那家公司工作。

en: We had a kid just last year.
zh: 我们去年刚生了个孩子。

en: Hence, loathed melancholy.
zh: 因此，厌恶忧郁。

en: Out of sight out of mind. When you're separated you lose touch.
zh: 眼不见，心不烦。 分开后，你们就失去了联系。

en: My sister married a high school teacher last June.
zh: 我姐姐去年六月嫁给了一位高中老师。

en: The milkman came around at six every morning.
zh: 送牛奶的人每天早上六点左右来。

en: We are faced with new kinds of diseases.
zh: 我们面临着新型疾病。

en: We began on a new project.
zh: 我们开始了一个新项目。

en: Now that we are established in our new house we shall be glad to receive visitors.
zh: 既然我们已经在新房子里安顿下来了，我们很乐意接待访客。

en: We've got to move very carefully.
zh: 我们必须非常小心地行动。

en: We enjoyed ourselves to the fullest.
zh: 我们玩得很尽兴。

en: We live in a three-bedroom house.
zh: 我们住在一栋三居室的房子里。

en: We must pay attention to traffic signals.
zh: 我们必须注意交通信号。

en: We went into a shop to get some food.
zh: 我们走进一家商店买些食物。

en: We must always try to serve others.
zh: 我们必须始终努力为他人服务。

en: We should always be careful of what we do.
zh: 我们应该始终小心我们所做的事情。

en: We must always do our best.
zh: 我们必须始终尽力而为。

en: We must always be prepared for disasters.
zh: 我们必须始终为灾难做好准备。

en: We must always be prepared for the worst.
zh: 我们必须始终为最坏的情况做好准备。

en: We are always aiming at improving the quality of service.
zh: 我们始终致力于提高服务质量。

en: We heard a cry from above.
zh: 我们听到一声来自上方的哭声。

en: We have to stand up for minority rights.
zh: 我们必须捍卫少数族裔的权利。

en: We headed for the mountain cottage.
zh: 我们朝山间小屋走去。

en: We discussed our future plan.
zh: 我们讨论了我们未来的计划。

en: We have to look the future straight in the eye and prepare to get through the coming crisis.
zh: 我们必须正视未来，并准备好度过即将到来的危机。

en: We must provide for the future.
zh: 我们必须为未来做好准备。

en: We had to start our business from zero.
zh: 我们不得不从零开始创业。

en: We are firmly confident of victory.
zh: 我们对胜利充满信心。

en: We ought to win.
zh: 我们应该会赢。

en: We said we should win.
zh: 我们说我们应该会赢。

en: We laid the injured man on the grass.
zh: 我们把受伤的人放在草地上。

en: Air is a mixture of several gases.
zh: 空气是几种气体的混合物。

en: Air, like food, is a basic human need.
zh: 空气和食物一样，是人类的基本需求。

en: The air was infected with photochemical smog.
zh: 空气受到了光化学烟雾的污染。

en: Air is a mixture of gases.
zh: 空气是气体的混合物。

en: The air is a medium for sound.
zh: 空气是声音的传播介质。

en: The air is soft, the soil moist.
zh: 空气柔软，土壤湿润。

en: Air is a mixture of various gases.
zh: 空气是各种气体的混合物。

en: Air is indispensable to life.
zh: 空气对生命是不可或缺的。

en: As for the air, there is always some moisture in the atmosphere, but when the amount increases a great deal, it affects the light waves.
zh: 至于空气，大气中总是含有一些水分，但是当水分大量增加时，会影响光波。

en: Air quality has deteriorated these past few years.
zh: 这几年空气质量恶化了。

en: The idea that air has weight was surprising to the child.
zh: 空气有重量这个概念让孩子感到惊讶。

en: We cannot live without air.
zh: 没有空气我们就无法生存。

en: Both air and water are indispensable for life.
zh: 空气和水对生命都是不可或缺的。

en: If it were not for air and water, we could not live.
zh: 如果没有空气和水，我们就无法生存。

en: Without air and water, nothing could live.
zh: 没有空气和水，任何生物都无法生存。

en: Air is to man what water is to fish.
zh: 空气之于人类，犹如水之于鱼。

en: If it were not for air, we could not live on the earth.
zh: 如果没有空气，我们就无法在地球上生存。

en: The balloon descended gradually as the air came out.
zh: 随着空气的排出，气球逐渐下降。

en: The air became warm.
zh: 空气变得温暖起来。

en: Were it not for air, no creatures could live.
zh: 如果没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: No living thing could live without air.
zh: 没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: Without air, nothing could live.
zh: 没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: We would die without air.
zh: 没有空气我们会死亡。

en: But for air, nothing could live.
zh: 如果没有空气，任何生物都无法生存。

en: It is clear that we cannot live without air.
zh: 很明显，没有空气我们就无法生存。

en: We must provide for old age.
zh: 我们必须为老年做好准备。

en: We were worried we might miss the train.
zh: 我们担心可能会错过火车。

en: We started early so as not to miss the train.
zh: 我们早点出发，以免错过火车。

en: We are very interested in the history.
zh: 我们对历史非常感兴趣。

en: We helped each other to overcome the difficulties.
zh: 我们互相帮助克服困难。

en: We should cultivate our minds by reading good books.
zh: 我们应该通过阅读好书来陶冶情操。

en: We should obey our parents.
zh: 我们应该孝敬父母。

en: We had to walk the last leg of the journey.
zh: 我们不得不步行完成旅程的最后一段。

en: Can we check the rapid spread of the 'flu?
zh: 我们能阻止流感的迅速蔓延吗？

en: We rowed up the river against the current.
zh: 我们逆流而上划船。

en: We entered the room by the back door.
zh: 我们从后门进入房间。

en: We had to put off the meeting because of the storm.
zh: 由于暴风雨，我们不得不推迟会议。

en: We were caught in a storm.
zh: 我们遇到了暴风雨。

en: We took cover from the thunder shower.
zh: 我们躲避雷阵雨。

en: We agreed to start early the next morning.
zh: 我们同意第二天早上早点出发。

en: It is important that we make plans in relation to anticipated changes.
zh: 重要的是，我们要根据预期的变化制定计划。

en: We arrived here in the evening.
zh: 我们傍晚到达这里。

en: We got together for short meeting after dinner.
zh: 晚饭后我们聚在一起开了一个简短的会议。

en: We carried on the discussion till late at night.
zh: 我们一直讨论到深夜。

en: We talked late into the night.
zh: 我们聊到深夜。

en: We discussed the problem far into the night.
zh: 我们讨论这个问题到深夜。

en: We advanced under cover of darkness.
zh: 我们在夜幕的掩护下前进。

en: We passed through a town at night.
zh: 我们晚上穿过了一个城镇。

en: We use computers to solve problems and to put information in order.
zh: 我们使用计算机来解决问题和整理信息。

en: We have achieved all our aims.
zh: 我们已经实现了所有的目标。

en: We have some pressing problems to solve.
zh: 我们有一些紧迫的问题需要解决。

en: I will show you how to solve it.
zh: 我会告诉你如何解决它。

en: He went to France to brush up on his speaking ability.
zh: 他去法国是为了提高他的口语能力。

en: Being a good conversationalist does not just mean being a good speaker of English.
zh: 成为一个好的健谈者不仅仅意味着英语说得好。

en: In conversation, one is likely to find out certain things about the other person quite easily.
zh: 在谈话中，人们很容易发现对方的某些事情。

en: Do you know that conversation is one of the greatest pleasures in life?
zh: 你知道谈话是人生最大的乐趣之一吗？

en: When you enter a conversation, you should have something to say.
zh: 当你加入谈话时，你应该有话要说。

en: Won't you join our conversation?
zh: 你要不要加入我们的谈话？

en: Wit is to conversation what salt is to food.
zh: 机智之于谈话，犹如盐之于食物。

en: Why don't you join in the conversation?
zh: 你为什么不加入谈话呢？

en: Cross off the names of the people who have paid their dues.
zh: 把已经交了会费的人的名字划掉。

en: With regard to the membership fee, you must ask the treasurer of the club.
zh: 关于会员费，你必须问俱乐部的财务主管。

en: Many members dropped out of the club when the dues were raised.
zh: 当会费提高时，许多成员退出了俱乐部。

en: The hall resounded with pealing bells.
zh: 大厅里回荡着洪亮的钟声。

en: For whom will you vote for president?
zh: 你打算投票给谁当总统？

en: The President did me the courtesy of replying to my letter.
zh: 总统很客气地回复了我的信。

en: You cannot be too polite when you meet the president.
zh: 当你见到总统时，再怎么礼貌也不为过。

en: The talks continued for two days.
zh: 会谈持续了两天。

en: The hall was filled with such a large audience that there wasn't even standing room.
zh: 大厅里挤满了观众，甚至没有站立的地方。

en: This hall was full of people.
zh: 这个大厅里挤满了人。

en: The concert hall was so jam-packed there wasn't room to breathe.
zh: 音乐厅里挤得水泄不通，连呼吸的空间都没有。

en: The congregation was moved by the fine sermon.
zh: 会众被精彩的布道所感动。

en: We held a party in honor of the 20th anniversary of our company.
zh: 我们举办了一个派对来庆祝我们公司成立20周年。

en: Send this parcel to him in care of his company.
zh: 请把这个包裹寄给他，转交他的公司。

en: We need a new leader to pull our company together.
zh: 我们需要一个新的领导者来团结我们的公司。

en: Don't worry!
zh: 别担心！

en: I’ll call them tomorrow when I return home.
zh: 我明天回家后给他们打电话。

en: I'll call after going home tomorrow.
zh: 我明天回家后打电话。

en: I always liked strange personalities.
zh: 我一直喜欢古怪的性格。

en: Let's go!
zh: 我们走吧！

en: I'll go.
zh: 我去。

en: I will go.
zh: 我会去的。

en: You really annoy me.
zh: 你真烦人。

en: Unfortunately, that's true.
zh: 很不幸，这是真的。

en: That's my line!
zh: 这应该是我的台词！

en: That's my line.
zh: 这应该是我的台词。

en: He is kicking me!
zh: 他在踢我！

en: Is that true?
zh: 是真的吗？

en: Really?
zh: 真的吗？

en: Step on it!
zh: 快点！

en: Hurry!
zh: 快点！

en: Get a move on.
zh: 快点。

en: It's not surprising.
zh: 这不足为奇。

en: Are you kidding?
zh: 你在开玩笑吧？

en: I've never said such a stupid thing.
zh: 我从来没说过这么蠢的话。

en: If you want to earn money, America is the best.
zh: 如果你想挣钱，美国是最好的。

en: I'm very fat.
zh: 我很胖。

en: I'm extremely fat.
zh: 我非常胖。

en: What's your point?
zh: 你想说什么？

en: And now, what?
zh: 然后呢，你想怎么样？

en: Is the bank open?
zh: 银行开门了吗？

en: Banks open at nine o'clock.
zh: 银行九点开门。

en: The bank is three blocks away.
zh: 银行在三个街区之外。

en: I recognized the bank teller as the man I had seen in the movie theater.
zh: 我认出银行柜员就是我在电影院见过的那个男人。

en: I ran across an old friend near the bank.
zh: 我在银行附近偶遇一位老朋友。

en: I've got to get some money somehow to repay the bank loan.
zh: 我必须想办法弄到一些钱来偿还银行贷款。

en: You'll have to get off at the bank and take the A52.
zh: 你必须在银行下车，然后乘坐A52路。

en: Some people do not like to deposit their money in banks.
zh: 有些人不喜欢把钱存在银行里。

en: The balance at the bank stands at two million yen.
zh: 银行的余额是两百万日元。

en: Please go to the bank.
zh: 请去银行。

en: We must ask the bank for the loan.
zh: 我们必须向银行申请贷款。

en: The bank will cash your fifty dollar check.
zh: 银行会兑现你五十美元的支票。

en: While employed at the bank, he taught economics at college.
zh: 他在银行工作期间，还在大学教经济学。

en: I'm afraid the bank is going to repossess my house.
zh: 恐怕银行要收回我的房子了。

en: How much money do you have in the bank?
zh: 你在银行里有多少钱？

en: Please deposit the money in a bank.
zh: 请把钱存入银行。

en: When you put money in the bank, you deposit it.
zh: 当你把钱存入银行时，你就存款了。

en: I made a deposit of $1,000 at the bank.
zh: 我在银行存了1000美元。

en: Banks will try to lend you an umbrella on a sunny day, but they will turn their backs on a rainy day.
zh: 晴天时银行会设法借给你一把伞，雨天时他们却会背弃你。

en: You'll find the shop between a bank and a school.
zh: 你会发现那家商店在银行和学校之间。

en: He works for a bank.
zh: 他在银行工作。

en: I have to withdraw some cash from the bank.
zh: 我必须从银行取一些现金。

en: Please draw a hundred thousand yen from the bank.
zh: 请从银行提取十万日元。

en: A banking scandal is sweeping across Capitol Hill.
zh: 一场银行业丑闻正在席卷国会山。

en: How do you expect to weather the financial storm when the bank refuses to extend a helping hand?
zh: 当银行拒绝伸出援手时，你打算如何度过金融风暴？

en: You are too old not to see the reason.
zh: 你都这么大年纪了，不应该看不出道理。

en: I take it that you are fully acquainted with the facts.
zh: 我猜你已经完全了解情况了。

en: You are too negligent of those around you.
zh: 你太忽略你周围的人了。

en: You won't be in time for school.
zh: 你上学要迟到了。

en: You should give up drinking.
zh: 你应该戒酒。

en: You should not resort to drinking.
zh: 你不应该借酒消愁。

en: You should give up drinking and smoking.
zh: 你应该戒烟戒酒。

en: You ought not to have spent so much money on your hobby.
zh: 你不该在你的爱好上花这么多钱。

en: You have a light hand, don't you?
zh: 你手很轻巧，是吧？

en: Since you like to write letters, why don't you drop her a line?
zh: 既然你喜欢写信，为什么不给她写一封呢？

en: Are you writing a letter?
zh: 你在写信吗？

en: You needn't have gone to the trouble.
zh: 你本不必那么麻烦的。

en: He looks young. He cannot be older than I.
zh: 他看起来很年轻。他不可能比我大。

en: You are young. I, on the contrary, am very old.
zh: 你很年轻。相反，我已经很老了。

en: You should pay back your debts.
zh: 你应该还清你的债务。

en: You should pay your debts.
zh: 你应该还债。

en: You should get your car fixed.
zh: 你应该把你的车修一下。

en: You had better have your car washed.
zh: 你最好把你的车洗一下。

en: You cannot be too careful when driving.
zh: 开车时再小心也不为过。

en: You had better not drive a car.
zh: 你最好不要开车。

en: Can you drive a car?
zh: 你会开车吗？

en: You can drive a car, can't you?
zh: 你会开车，是吗？

en: You don't have to make an apology.
zh: 你不必道歉。

en: You should apologize.
zh: 你应该道歉。

en: Did you actually see the accident?
zh: 你真的亲眼看到那场事故了吗？

en: No cross, no crown.
zh: 不经历风雨，怎能见彩虹。

en: No gain without pains.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: Toil and worry caused his health to break down.
zh: 劳累和忧虑损害了他的健康。

en: If you're not prepared to take the trouble to learn how to train a dog, don't get one.
zh: 如果你不准备费心学习如何训练狗，就别养狗。

en: All my troubles came to nothing.
zh: 我所有的烦恼都白费了。

en: We arrived at that plan out of pure desperation, but the book sold well.
zh: 我们出于绝望才制定了那个计划，但这本书卖得很好。

en: I cannot bear the pain any more.
zh: 我再也无法忍受这种痛苦了。

en: His face is distorted by pain.
zh: 他的脸因痛苦而扭曲。

en: After all the trouble we went to in coming up with that project, it only took them a second to shoot it down in the meeting.
zh: 我们费了那么大的劲才想出那个项目，结果他们在会议上只用了一秒钟就否决了。

en: That was well worth the trouble.
zh: 那非常值得付出努力。

en: Make sure that the complaints are dealt with as quickly as possible.
zh: 确保尽快处理这些投诉。

en: No pain, no gains.
zh: 没有付出，就没有收获。

en: It helps us in times of difficulty.
zh: 它在困难时期帮助我们。

en: It is man's lot to suffer.
zh: 受苦是人的命运。

en: It's so painful. Stop it!
zh: 太疼了。 停下来！

en: Danger past, God forgotten.
zh: 渡过难关就忘记神。

en: No sweet without sweat.
zh: 不付出汗水就没有甜蜜。

en: The 1990's saw various incidents.
zh: 20世纪90年代发生过各种事件。

en: The bus service is not good between nine and ten.
zh: 九点到十点之间的巴士服务不好。

en: I make it a rule not to watch television after nine o'clock.
zh: 我有个规矩，九点以后不看电视。

en: I'd like you to come at nine.
zh: 我希望你九点来。

en: I escaped death.
zh: 我死里逃生。

en: Have you ever had a narrow escape?
zh: 你有没有经历过死里逃生？

en: By September the burst in spending seemed to be tapering off.
zh: 到九月份，消费热潮似乎正在减退。

en: By September I will have known her for a whole year.
zh: 到九月份，我就认识她整整一年了。

en: Has the shipment arrived yet?
zh: 货运到了吗？

en: Send your baggage in advance.
zh: 请提前托运行李。

en: The load was too heavy for a driver to carry alone.
zh: 这批货物太重了，司机一个人搬不动。

en: How many bags do you have?
zh: 你有几个包？

en: Where should I put my baggage?
zh: 我应该把行李放在哪里？

en: Where can I get my baggage?
zh: 我在哪里可以取到我的行李？

en: I have three pieces of baggage.
zh: 我有三件行李。

en: Will you look after my baggage?
zh: 你能帮我照看行李吗？

en: Attach this label to your package.
zh: 把这个标签贴在你的包裹上。

en: In case the shipment is delayed, we have special delay insurance.
zh: 如果货物延误，我们有专门的延误保险。

en: There is nothing left to do aside from packing.
zh: 除了打包，没什么可做的了。

en: The label is attached to the trunk.
zh: 标签贴在行李箱上了。

en: Have you finished packing yet?
zh: 你打包好了吗？

en: Company A is trying to play us off against Company B in a severe price-war.
zh: A公司正试图利用我们与B公司进行激烈的价格战。

en: I have an allergy to pollen.
zh: 我对花粉过敏。

en: Hold the vase in both hands.
zh: 用双手捧住花瓶。

en: I filled a vase with water.
zh: 我往花瓶里装满了水。

en: I must apologize to you for breaking the vase.
zh: 我必须为打碎花瓶向您道歉。

en: The vase burst into fragments.
zh: 花瓶碎成了碎片。

en: The vase fell to the floor and shattered.
zh: 花瓶掉在地上摔碎了。

en: The vase fell from the table and crashed to pieces.
zh: 花瓶从桌子上掉下来摔成了碎片。

en: The flowers in the vase are roses.
zh: 花瓶里的花是玫瑰。

en: How many flowers are there in the vase?
zh: 花瓶里有多少朵花？

en: I see a rare flower in the vase.
zh: 我看到花瓶里有一朵稀有的花。

en: There are some beautiful roses in the vase.
zh: 花瓶里有一些美丽的玫瑰。
